intro: Vochya hondurensis, commonly known as the Honduras vochya, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, herbaceous stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green to yellow in color. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
